title: Service Contract: AGV & FED TECH S.R.L.
mainPoints: AGVOLUTION GmbH (AGV) commissions FED TECH S.R.L (Service Provider) for software development in farm management, data science, AgTech, IoT, and weather data.
The scope of work includes project planning, documentation (user stories, SCRUM planning, time/code documentation), and programming using the SCRUM method.
Compensation includes an hourly fee (€24/hr until 31.07.2025, then €27/hr) plus a 10% success fee on documented net customer turnover generated by AGV and assigned to the Service Provider.
Invoices for hourly work are paid within 14 days; success fees are paid 14 days after invoicing by Service Provider and AGV's receipt of client payment.

The Service Provider works on a freelance basis starting March 18, 2025, with no employer-employee relationship, and the contract can be terminated with four weeks' notice to the end of a calendar month.
Strict confidentiality is required, even after termination, and the Service Provider is prohibited from working for direct competitors or advising on competing products without AGV's written consent.
Travel expenses are reimbursed at agreed rates (€90/night, €0.38/km), but other costs are borne by the Service Provider, who must also hold business liability insurance.
overallSummary: This service contract outlines the terms under which FED TECH S.R.L (Service Provider) will provide software development and related services to AGVOLUTION GmbH (AGV) on a freelance basis. The scope includes project planning, documentation, and programming for AGV's climate-intelligent solutions in agriculture.

Compensation comprises an hourly rate, which increases from €24 to €27 per hour from August 1, 2025, and a 10% success fee based on customer turnover attributed to the Service Provider. Key clauses include a non-compete obligation, strict confidentiality, and a requirement for the Service Provider to maintain business liability insurance.

The agreement, effective March 18, 2025, emphasizes a freelance relationship, allowing the Service Provider to work for other clients as long as there is no conflict of interest. Disputes will be governed by German law, with Hamburg courts having jurisdiction.
